text:
I thought I might make it
as a journalist.
Turns out I'm better with numbers.

I'm Andy Durman,
I'm the Executive Vice President

for the global business unit
at Lightcast.

We work
with regional government agencies

who are trying to help
employers and educators
within their communities understand
what skills are needed by employers

so that that can align
to training opportunities

and help citizens
that they serve connect

the skills that they have to the
employers that are seeking them.
The world is changing at a real pace

and so, we can't just look
at what has happened a year ago,
six months ago.

We are needing
and gathering data together

on a daily basis
about what employers are seeking

and so, we need an environment
that allows us
to update our data rapidly

and deploy that to our customers
in the cloud on an hourly basis.
So, we need a stable platform

in which we can operate,
undertake, build our data,

deliver our resources,
deliver our datasets,
deliver our solutions.

AWS is a critical part of that
infrastructure that enables us.

And certainly working in the public
sector, working across Europe

we need ways of working
that are highly compliant

with the evolving regulatory
structures and systems.
So, the new AI rules and regulations

that are evolving across Europe
is a great example of why

working with AWS,
we know we can trust

that we're compliant
and that we're able to operate

in an ever-changing,
regulatory environment.
